case_title: AZIZULLAH KHAN ETC. vs Haji ABDUL JALIL AND ANOTHER

prosecution: Mian Muhammad Younas Shah, Advocate, Peshawar

complaint_summary: The petitioner sought an extension of the period for payment of court-fee, which was rejected by the Assistant Collector 1st Grade. This decision was upheld by the Collector and Additional Commissioner.
judgment_summary: The revision petitions were rejected in limine due to the petitioner's failure to provide sufficient cause for not availing the time limit for payment of court-fee arrears. Concurrent findings of lower courts were upheld.
legal_arguments: The petitioner argued that the court had jurisdiction to extend the time for payment of court-fee even after the period expired.
The court ruled that once discretion is exercised and an order is announced, it ceases to have further jurisdiction.
The Additional Commissioner relied on a precedent from P L D 1956 Dacca 280 to conclude that the court was functus officio after the expiry of the time limit.
sections: Section 148 of the Civil Procedure Code
key_issues: Jurisdiction of court to extend time for payment of court-fee after expiry of the period

maxims.functus officio: A court or tribunal loses jurisdiction to alter its decision once it has been finalized.

legal_terms.functus officio: A legal principle indicating that a court or authority has exhausted its jurisdiction over a matter.

words_and_phrases.functus officio: No longer having authority or legal competence to act.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a dispute over the extension of time for payment of court-fee. The petitioner failed to provide sufficient cause for the delay, and the court ruled that it lacked jurisdiction to extend the time after the expiry of the original period. The decision was based on Section 148 of the Civil Procedure Code and precedent from P L D 1956 Dacca 280.

legal_basis.challenged_orders: Assistant Collector 1st Grade order dated 12-11-1973 rejecting extension for payment of court-fee
legal_basis.statute_cited: Section 148 of the Civil Procedure Code

key_findings.court_discretion: Court has discretion to extend time for payment of court-fee under Section 148 of CPC.
key_findings.jurisdiction_limit: Once discretion is exercised and order announced, court becomes functus officio.
key_findings.petitioner_fault: Petitioner failed to utilize the one-month time limit without sufficient cause.

advocate_for_petitioner: Mian Muhammad Younas Shah, Advocate, Peshawar
